title: US 175 Freeway Removal

pageHeader.title: S.M. Wright Freeway Removal
pageHeader.subTitle: A new boulevard will replace it

text: The new connection to Interstate 45 opened in July 2020. Work could then start on the freeway removal. The freeway is being replaced with a six-lane, architecturally-enchanced boulevard. As of April 2023, all main lanes and main lane overpasses were demolished. The new boulevard-style street was ready on the south end, with work just starting on the north end.

images.caption: The freeway was called South Central Expressway before it was renamed S.M. Wright Freeway in 1995. It will be called S.M. Wright Boulevard after the freeway removal.
Looking north at Elsie Faye Heggins street. The overpass and embankment are removed, and the pavement for the replacement street is in place.
Looking north at Pine Street. The overpass and embankment are removed.
Looking north at Pine Street.
The freeway was still open going northbound north of Pine Street in June 2021.
Going northbound on the freeway main lanes. The southbound lanes at this location were permanently closed at the time of this photo.
The next crossing is at Metropolitan Avenue. This overpass was still intact at the time of this photo. It was in use by northbound traffic but was closed to southbound traffic.
Looking north toward the Metropolitan Avenue intersection in September 2022. The overpass is fully removed.
Another view of the Metropolitan Avenue intersection in September 2022.
Driving northbound on the main lanes. Ahead the closure of the southbound lanes is visible. This view features an old design light fixture with support rods.
In the southbound direction, traffic is forced to exit at the Metropolitan Avenue exit.
Looking north, north of Metropolitan Avenue
The Pennsylvania Avenue overpass remains intact and is still in use by both directions of traffic in September 2022.
This view looks north, north of Pine Street, showing an orphaned on-ramp sign.
In September 2021 both directions of traffic were on the west side of the corridor. Ahead, the freeway main lanes were still open to traffic.
Looking northbound with the Metropolitan Avenue overpass ahead. In March 2022 the main lanes were still open from Metropolitan Avenue northward.
New street and sidewalk near Pine street.

As of April 2023, all main lanes and overpasses were demolished. The underpass at MLK boulevard was filled to ground level with dirt. This view looks north with Pennsylvania Avenue crossing just ahead.
A wide-angle view looking north, south of Pennsylvania Avenue.
Looking northbound at Interstate 45 ahead. New connection ramps along interstate 45 were under construction.
